tool_description:
Email Verification by Emailable is astonishingly easy and low-cost. Simple, reliable, and affordable list cleaning shouldn’t be hard to find. Emailable helps marketers and developers build powerful and effective marketing campaigns.
View API Docs | Click Here to Sign Up for an API Key
name: Blaze Verify
title: Blaze Verify

api_list.name: Get account info
api_list.description: Get general account information like the email of the account owner and available credits.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://blaze-verify.p.rapidapi.com/v1/account"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "blaze-verify.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://blaze-verify.p.rapidapi.com/v1/account"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "blaze-verify.p.rapidapi.com"

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get the status of a batch
api_list.description:
GET requests to the batch endpoint will get the current status of the batch verification job specified in the "id" parameter.

When a credit card transaction is necessary to obtain enough credits to verify a batch, billing related messages will be returned if there is an error. These will be sent with a 402 response code.

api_list.name: Verify an email
api_list.description: Verify a single email. If a verification request takes longer than the timeout, you may retry this request for up to 5 minutes. After 5 minutes, further requests will count against your usage. The verification result will be returned when it is available.

optional_parameters.name: accept_all
optional_parameters.description: Does an accept-all check. Heavily impacts API's response time. Default: false

optional_parameters.name: smtp
optional_parameters.description: The SMTP step takes up a majority of the API's response time. If you would like to speed up your response times, you can disable this step. Default: true

optional_parameters.name: timeout
optional_parameters.description: Optional timeout to wait for response (in seconds). Min: 2, Max: 30. Default: 5
